annotations.label: Page-header
annotations.text: EN
annotations.translation: 英语

annotations.label: Page-header
annotations.text: Official Journal of the European Communities
annotations.translation: 欧洲共同体官方公报

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 3.4. Studies on the effects on the characteristics of animal wastes
annotations.translation: 3.4. 对动物粪便特性影响的研究

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: If the additive is intended to modify some characteristics of animal waste (e.g. nitrogen, phosphorus, odour, volume), then studies demonstrating these properties are required.
annotations.translation: 如果添加剂旨在改变动物粪便的某些特性（例如氮、磷、气味、体积），则需要进行研究，证明这些特性。

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: 4. Section IV: Studies concerning the safety of use of the additive
annotations.translation: 4. 第四节：添加剂使用安全性研究

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: The studies outlined in this section are intended to permit assessment of:
annotations.translation: 本节概述的研究旨在对以下方面进行评估：

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: the safety of use of the additive in the target species,
annotations.translation: 在目标物种中使用添加剂的安全性，

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: any risk associated with the selection and/or transfer of resistance to antibiotics and increased persistence and shedding of enteropathogens,
annotations.translation: 与抗生素耐药性的选择和/或转移以及肠道病原体的持续存在和脱落增加有关的任何风险，

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: the risks to the consumer which could result from the consumption of food containing residues of the additive or its metabolites,
annotations.translation: 因食用含有该添加剂或其代谢物残留的食品而可能给消费者造成的风险，

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: the risks from respiratory, other mucosal, eye or cutaneous contact for persons likely to handle the additive as such or as incorporated into premixtures or feedingstuffs,
annotations.translation: 对于可能处理添加剂或将其掺入预混物或饲料中的人员造成的呼吸道、其他粘膜、眼睛或皮肤接触的风险，

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: the risks of adverse effects on the environment, from the additive itself or by products derived from the additive, either directly and/or excreted by animals.
annotations.translation: 添加剂本身或添加剂衍生的产品直接和/或由动物排泄对环境产生不利影响的风险。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Consideration should be given to known incompatibilities and/or interactions between the additive and veterinary medicines and/or components of the diet relevant to the species concerned.
annotations.translation: 应考虑添加剂与兽药和/或与相关物种有关的饮食成分之间已知的不相容性和/或相互作用。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: These studies will normally be required in their entirety for each additive unless a specific exclusion or modification is specified in the Directive.
annotations.translation: 通常要求对每种添加剂进行完整的这些研究，除非在指令中规定了特定的例外或修改。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: A more limited submission will normally be accepted for a proposed extension of the authorised use to a species which is physiologically and metabolically close to one in which the use of the additive has already been approved. This reduced data set should demonstrate safety to the new species and lack of significant differences in metabolic fate and residues in edible tissues. The proposed MRL and withdrawal period for the species must be justified.
annotations.translation: 对于将授权使用范围扩大到在生理和代谢方面与已获准使用该添加剂的物种相近的物种的提议，通常会接受较为有限的呈文。 缩减后的数据集应证明对新物种的安全性，以及在代谢转归和可食用组织中的残留方面没有显著差异。对该物种的拟议最大残留限量和停用期必须说明理由。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: In order to assess the risks for the consumer and consequently the determination of the MRLS and the withdrawal period the following information has to be provided:
annotations.translation: 为了评估消费者面临的风险，从而确定最大残留限量和停用期，必须提供以下信息：

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: the chemical structure of the active substance,
annotations.translation: 活性物质的化学结构，

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: the metabolism in the proposed target species,
annotations.translation: 拟议目标物种的新陈代谢，

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: the nature of the residues in these target species,
annotations.translation: 这些目标物种中残留物的性质，

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: tissue depletion study of residues,
annotations.translation: 残留物的组织耗竭研究，

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: data on the biological effects of the active substance together with its metabolites.
annotations.translation: 活性物质及其代谢物的生物效应数据。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: A knowledge of the bioavailability of the residues (both unbound and bound) may also be useful namely when many metabolites are produced and no marker residues is evidenced (see section 4.1.3.3).
annotations.translation: 了解残留物（包括未结合的和结合的）的生物利用率也可能很有用，即当产生许多代谢物而未见标记残留物时（见第 4.1.3.3 节）。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Furthermore, knowledge of the composition and of the physico-chemical and biological properties of the major excreted materials deriving from the additive are required to define the extent of the studies necessary for assessment of the risk of adverse effects on the environment or persistence in the environment (see paragraph 4.5).
annotations.translation: 此外，还需要了解由添加剂产生的主要排泄物的成分、物理化学和生物特性，以确定评估对环境的不利影响或在环境中的持久性风险所需的研究范围（见第 4.5 段）。
